messages.content: What is ComfyUI-Lora-Auto-Trigger-Words?
ComfyUI-Lora-Auto-Trigger-Words is a project that provides custom nodes to access tags used to trigger Lora in ComfyUI.
Is ComfyUI-Lora-Auto-Trigger-Words compatible with Stacked Loras?
Yes, ComfyUI-Lora-Auto-Trigger-Words is compatible with Stacked Loras from https://github.com/LucianoCirino/efficiency-nodes-comfyui/releases.
Does ComfyUI-Lora-Auto-Trigger-Words support Lycoris as well?
Yes, ComfyUI-Lora-Auto-Trigger-Words supports both Lora and Lycoris.
What are the different types of nodes available in ComfyUI-Lora-Auto-Trigger-Words?
The nodes available are: LoraLoader (Vanilla or Advanced), LoraLoaderStacked (Vanilla or Avanced), TagsFormater, tagsSelector, FusionText, Randomizer, and TextInputBasic.
What is the purpose of the LoraLoaderAdvanced and LoraLoaderStacked nodes?
LoraLoaderAdvanced and LoraLoaderStacked nodes allow loading a lora either the normal way or the efficiency-nodes way and provide two custom outputs: civitai_tags_list and meta_tags_list.
What is the function of the TagsFormater node?
The TagsFormater node is a helper to show the available tag and their indexes.
Can TagsSelectors be chained?
Yes, TagsSelectors can be chained to select different tags with different weights.
What is needed for the 'showText' node to know the content of the tag lists?
For the 'showText' node to know the content of the tag lists, Custom-Scripts is recommended to be installed.
What do the custom outputs civitai_tags_list and meta_tags_list provide?
civitai_tags_list provides a Python list of the tags related to this lora on Civitai, while meta_tags_list provides a Python list of the tags used for training the lora embedded in it.
What is the function of the 'tagsSelector' node?
The 'tagsSelector' node allows filtering tags and applying a weight to them. It has four parameters: selector, weight, ensure_comma, and append_loraname_if_empty.
